hook.text: The average phone has 80 apps installed. Most people use fewer than 10 regularly. The rest are attention traps.

buildup.text: Every app on your home screen is a visual cue. More cues mean more temptation. More temptation means more distraction.

discovery.text: Moving social media off the home screen reduces usage by 30%. Visibility drives behavior more than intention.

twist.text: You don't need to delete every app. Just move distracting ones to a second page or a folder. Friction reduces impulse.

climax.text: Keep only tools on your home screen: calendar, maps, notes. Move everything else. Watch your phone time drop.

punchline.text: Declutter your home screen. Fewer cues mean fewer distractions.

quiz.question: How much does moving social media off the home screen reduce usage?
